name: Buck Island Reef National Monument
description: Welcome to Buck Island Reef National Monument, called “the finest marine garden in the Caribbean Sea” by President John F. Kennedy. Snorkel the famous underwater trail, explore endangered elkhorn coral reefs. Hike the trails on the 176-acre island to the observation platform for an unparallel view. Discover a vibrant world above and beneath the waves in this Caribbean paradise.
shortDescription: Welcome to Buck Island Reef National Monument, called “the finest marine garden in the Caribbean Sea” by President John F. Kennedy. Snorkel the famous underwater trail, explore endangered elkhorn cora...

operatingHours.description:
Buck Island Reef National Monument is open year-round, every day of the week. The current operating hours are 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.

There is no overnight camping on the island; the park is closed at night to protect nesting sea turtles.

Camping is not allowed on the island.

images.title: Elkhorn Coral at Buck Island Reef NM
images.altText: Snorkeler swimming by Elkhorn Coral at Buck Island Reef NM.
images.caption: Snorkelers may view Elkhorn Coral at the Underwater Trail, Buck Island Reef NM

images.title: Buck Island Reef NM Underwater Trail
images.altText: Snorkelers in formation departing the concessioner's vessel in route to the underwater trail.
images.caption: Snorkelers are lead in small groups through the underwater trail at Buck Island Reef NM.

images.title: Tropical dry forest, Buck Island
images.altText: Photograph of the trees and vegetation along the hiking trail on Buck Island
images.caption: The plants that make up the subtropical dry forest on Buck Island range from old historic tamarinds to gumbo limbo, from cactus to delicate orchids.
images.credit: Photo by S. Corsaut, Digital Island

images.title: Snorkeling at Buck Island
images.altText: Photograph of snorkeler among the coral reefs at Buck Island
images.caption: Enjoy snorkeling the reefs and see lots of tropical reef fish.

images.title: Green sea turtle hatchling
images.altText: green sea turtle hatchling on beach heading towards the ocean
images.caption: For over 30 years scientists have studied sea turtle nesting habits on Buck Island, training over 100 students in the field of biology.

images.title: End of the rainbow
images.altText: Photograph of rainbow at Buck Island
images.caption: Buck Island is a magical place! Come snorkel the waters and hike the trails.

images.title: Beach at Buck Island
images.altText: the forest meets the sandy beach and waves
images.caption: Come see the unspoiled beauty of Buck Island

images.title: Buck Island from the water
images.altText: view of Buck Island from the water
images.caption: From the highest ridge to the water and reefs below, Buck Island offers adventure and learning.

images.title: Coral garden
images.caption: Our underwater trail will take you through beautiful gardens of coral.

images.title: Hiking trail
images.altText: hiking trail wandering through a beachside forest
images.caption: Take our hiking trail through beach forests up to the observation deck at 300 feet above sea leve.
